member.name: T:LinqLib.Operators.Action
member.summary: Extension methods applying actions on sequences.

member.name: M:LinqLib.Operators.Action.ForEach``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Performs the specified action on each element of the IEnumerable<TSource>.
member.remarks: This extension does not defers the execution all elements are processed once the method is called. If <TSource> is a value type, changes to the source elements will not be reflected in the return value of this function. It is best NOT to use this method to modify the content of the enumerated items, use the Select extension instead to project the modified value. ForEach is a good choice if you need to perform an action and use each element of the sequence as a parameter for your action.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of source.
member.param: The elements to perform the action on.
The System.Action<T> delegate to perform on each element of the IEnumerable<TSource>.
member.returns: The source sequence with any side effects from the action function.

member.name: M:LinqLib.Operators.Action.ForEach``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{``0,System.Int32})
member.summary: Performs the specified action on each element of the IEnumerable<TSource>.
member.remarks: This extension does not defers the execution all elements are processed once the method is called. If <TSource> is a value type, changes to the source elements will not be reflected in the return value of this function. It is best NOT to use this method to modify the content of the enumerated items, use the Select extension instead to project the modified value. ForEach is a good choice if you need to perform an action and use each element of the sequence as a parameter for your action.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of source.
member.param: The elements to perform the action on.
The System.Action<T> delegate to perform on each element of the IEnumerable<TSource>; the second parameter of the function represents the index of the source element.
member.returns: The source sequence with any side effects from the action function.

member.summary: Applies a pivot on a sequence property (sub sequence) in a sequence of objects.

The sub sequence to pivot.

member.summary: Returns the original name of the property / field name.
member.param: Property / field name.
member.returns: The original name of the property / field name.
member.exception: The Safe Runtime Name cannot be found.
member.remarks: When pivoting a sub collection, the new properties of the pivoted type gets their names from the content of elements in the sub collection. The content might not contain valid CLR names. THe Pivot function will correct the name to adhere to the .NET requirements. This method will lookup the original name based on the property / field name.

member.name: P:LinqLib.Sequence.Transformer.SafeNamePrefix
